1

II. Purpose of Addendum
The addendum is to describe the facility’s change in license type from child caring
institution to children’s therapeutic group home.
III. Methodology
05/12/10 Received written request from licensee to change the license to a
children’s therapeutic group home.
05/14/10 Consultant met with the licensee, the chief administrator, and staff
regarding the statutory criteria for licensure as a children’s therapeutic group home.
The consultant observed that the behavior management room has been converted
to a storage closet, to be used for extra clothing, bedding, and residents’ personal
items.
05/14/10 Received documentation from the licensee and chief administrator
indicating that all policies and procedures relating to the use of seclusion and
restraint/physical management have been removed from the program. New policy
has been implemented.
05/19/10 License type changed from child caring institution to children’s
therapeutic group home.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
The facility has submitted written documentation, indicating that all policies and
procedures related to the use of seclusion and restraint/physical management have
been removed from the program. A newly developed “Hand’s Off” policy was
submitted, and has been implemented. This policy indicates that no form of
seclusion and/or restraint/physical management may be used at the facility. The
policy further states that the department will be notified of any instance of the use of
a physical intervention, using the statutory definition of personal restraint. The
consultant met with the licensee, chief administrator, and child care staff on 05/12/10
to explain the statutory criteria for a children’s therapeutic group home, at which time
it was observed that the behavior management room has been converted to a
storage closet.
2

V. Recommendation
The recommendation continues to be for an original provisional license, for a
children’s therapeutic group home. The effective date of the license will not change.
